meanings.definition: Put at risk of being harmed, injured, or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the gate open could imperil the safety of the animals.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing a helmet while biking can imperil your head in case of a fall.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to bring an umbrella might imperil your hairdo in the rain.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs could imperil your chances of reaching your destination safely.
meanings.sent5: Playing with fire can imperil your fingers if you're not careful.

meanings.sent1: Swimming in rough waters can imperil even the strongest swimmers.
meanings.sent2: Leaving toxic chemicals unattended can imperil the health of those nearby.
meanings.sent3: Eating spicy food late at night might imperil your chances of a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the signs of exhaustion can imperil your ability to finish the race.
meanings.sent5: Driving recklessly can imperil the lives of everyone on the road.
